definition[0]: a hard silver-white metal that is often combined with other metals, for example to make steel. It is a chemical element: symbol Ni
definition[1]: a coin in the US or Canada that is worth five cents
example[0]: Gasoline rose more than a nickel a gallon.
definition[2]: a hard silver-white metal used in manufacturing and traded on COMMODITY MARKETs
example[1]: Nickel rose nearly as strongly as zinc on the London Metal Exchange yesterday.
